publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6007 Liam McArthur: Orkney Students Win Institute of Physics National Science and Engineering Prize—That the Parliament notes that two advanced higher physics students from Kirkwall Grammar School, Keith Alexander and Erik Bews, have won the prestigious Institute of Physics prize for physics for their research into wave testing facilities at the National Science and Engineering Competition at the Big Bang Fair in Manchester; recognises the importance to the future of Scotland of its best and brightest students studying science so that Scotland’s historic record of producing world-leading scientists and engineers can be maintained; believes that the success of these two Orcadian students shows that the teaching of science at Kirkwall Grammar School is of the highest quality, and congratulates both students on their well deserved success.
